title: Teemo - theme vs gameplay
body:
So. Not so long ago changes towards Nidalee (and jungle items) make her great jungler. And this is fine, as she is a sneaky hunter, that traverses jungle and catch these careless victims. It's how she appear in her lore, and it's how she is in game.

I readed some discussions about junglers, tanks, and some1 posted nice idea for teemo.
So. Acording to lore, he is a little scout, that is way ahead of his team, gather informations, sabotages his enemy. But currently in game he is more like ap magish, defensish, kinda nothing concrete. Blind and back, put maybe some autos and hope some1 step into mushrom. Either you force enemy back to base, or you fail early and your shrooms are useless. It's kinda boring playstyle, at least in my opinion.

And here is some ideas to make him more viable. Teemo main position should lie in the jungle. He gather his poison there, his real alterego show there. He thematically should be here
TL:DR
main change is for W and we start here
W
Active: Teemo change his weapon to either his dartgun or knife.
Dartgun - Gain 550 range. while he is back to the opponent, he gain movementspeed buff
knife - Lose range. Gain 20 flat movementspeed(counterstrike players will understand), 20% attack speed. while facing opponent he gain movementspeed buff
PassiveW: Killing big monsters (in the jungle) give him a mushroom

Passive:
Standing in 1 postioin give teemo a stealth. It refresh as teemo is standing and last 1.5s after he moves or until he do action.
Q
Dartgun - no changes, maybe make it on hit
Knife - Blind every1 around him and proc passive.

E
Remains as it is with 1 change - attacking monsters cause double the dmg. (numbers are needed to adjust)

R
less dmg, more shrooms, teemo gain movementspeed buff towards poisoned target (stacking with W).

That changes would shift Teemo more in to jungle position, where he should be (according to lore). He would become great sneaky counterjungle scout, that appear from nowhere, kill and disappear.

What you think about changes like these?.

I've been playing Teemo since season 1! I love his character to death, but lets be honest, as fun as his ultimate is, its annoying as hell for the enemy team.  It causes so much grief to his enemies, he becomes the target of everyones wrath.

I think a rework would't hurt.

Just change his move quick to something else. I was never a fan of his passive, but whatever...it kinda fits into his "scouting" theme.
Maybe just change his R to place a limited amount of shrooms, like 3-5.

Make him a roaming support/jungle where he has to collect mushrooms like bard collects chimes. Increase the vision range to maybe 3/4th of a regular ward. 

Give him 1 reliable cc on his Q - maybe a skill shot stunning dart? And no, I dont think blind counts are crowd control (especially with its paltry duration). IMO only disables - taunt, fear, stun, bind, count as cc. The rest - slow, blind are "soft cc", if you may.

Change his poison to do bonus damage on jungle monsters/creeps and you have a solid jungle, or a roaming support. Hell, you can even do top with him, but not as effectively, since you wont have an opportunity to "scout" as much.

I wish I get the opportunity to use the many skins I've collected for him without being a liability for my team or annoying the enemy team...maybe some day....

And exacly, movequick, as theme is great spell, but in game it's just weak. Rly weak

Try changing his build. {{item:3115}} {{item:3279}}  and I can throw mushrooms absolutely everywhere; the passive on Nashor's plus his passive poison plus a {{item:3089}}  and his AAs do a fair amount of magic damage. Throw in a {{item:3135}} and a  {{item:3151}} , whose passive double proccs on his traps, and his traps shred through even tanks.

Keep in mind his mushrooms have ALREADY been nerfed to be less powerful but more prolific. Nerf them any further and they'll become completely useless except as a warning alarm. TBH some wards and basic map awareness can already tell you the approximate position of enemies in the jungle post-laning phase; his shrooms serve a far better purpose as booby traps, both damaging the enemy AND deterring them from entering your jungle without a really good reason.
